body.p:
Louisville 4 January 1861
H I Todd Esq
Frankfort

Dear Sir We are very much annoyed in the Pay Department of the Army in preparing papers of dismissed, discharged and resigned officers and soldiers, having no Notary Public convenient. We want one constantly in the office. Will you do me the favor to ask the Gov to appoint Mr Charles Freedly whose business requires his constant attention at the Head Quarters of the Pay Department. He is a worthy man and well qualified for the place. and his appointment will give personal satisfaction. My friend Judge Bullitt, is in Frankfort, will. I am sure. join you in requesting the Early appointment of Mr Freedly. I enclose note from Mr Harris

Jefferson Co
Notary Public
Chas. Freedley
Comd. Jany 6. 1861
